intro: Stylisma evolvuloides var. vibracteosa, commonly known as the vibracteose stylisma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and the plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in shrublands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
